episodes.natural_language:
Case: Michae-Guyton-MVA-11-14-2025

Initial client contact on November 17, 2025, with Antonio Lopez regarding a motor vehicle accident that occurred on November 14, 2025, at the intersection of Eaton and Dixie Highway, where Michae Guyton’s vehicle was rear-ended at a traffic light. The other driver is identified as Antonio Lopez (DOB 11/09/1997). His SSN and phone number are on file but redacted here, and his address is listed but redacted. Progressive Personal Injury Protection (PIP) claim number 25695180369 is associated with this matter, and a civilian report was filed.

The record indicates Michae Guyton (also spelled Mich-Shae), born 08/06/1997, was involved in the accident. The note lists injuries as mid- and lower-back pain, and indicates that Michae went to UofL Downtown for evaluation. At UofL Hospital, injuries documented for Michae include back pain and pain in both shoulders. The record also lists A’zaire Lopez (DOB 03/22/2022; SSN redacted) and Mi’ayla Lopez (DOB 01/25/2025; SSN redacted) with entries indicating they have been seen at UofL Hospital in connection with the case.

The person making contact is identified as Justin, with the date and time recorded as November 17, 2025.

episodes.original_body:
Case: Michae-Guyton-MVA-11-14-2025
Client: Michae Guyton

FILE REORGANIZATION COMPLETE - Michae Guyton MVA Case: Completed comprehensive 5-phase file reorganization using 8-bucket directory system. Phase 1: Generated inventory of 11 files (5 scrambled .md files for content-only analysis). Phase 2: Analyzed all documents with content-based categorization (filenames scrambled to eliminate bias). Phase 3: Quality review achieved 0.0% error rate (perfect accuracy - 0 errors out of 5 files). Phase 4: Successfully executed 5 move operations, reunited all PDF companions. Phase 5: Verified 100% naming convention compliance and companion file integrity. Results: Client folder (4 files: 2 PDF+MD pairs - Intake Documents signed 11/17/2025 via Vinesign, Intake Verification Certificate), Investigation folder (2 files: 1 PDF+MD pair - Jefferson County Clerk Insurance Information Request for plate J8Z536), Insurance folder organized by type and carrier (4 files: BI/Auto Owners with Letter of Representation dated 11/18/2025 claim #300-0701136-2025, PIP/Progressive with Letter of Representation dated 11/18/2025 claim #25695180369 with special instructions to reserve $4,000 and use $6,000 for bills, DO NOT pay hospital bills). Key case information: Multi-party case with 4 clients (Mi'Ayla Lopez, Antonio Lopez, A'zaire Lopez, and Michae Guyton), accident date 11/14/2025, rear-end collision at Eaton and Dixie Highway, client transported to UofL Hospital downtown with injuries to back pain and both shoulders. Fee Agreement: 33.36% pre-suit, 40% post-suit. All files now properly organized with zero errors and ready for treatment phase. Complete documentation saved to Reports/ directory.
episodes.natural_language:
Case Michae-Guyton-MVA-11-14-2025 involves four clients—Mi'Ayla Lopez, Antonio Lopez, A'zaire Lopez, and Michae Guyton—related to a motor vehicle accident that occurred on November 14, 2025. The incident was a rear-end collision at the intersection of Eaton and Dixie Highway. The clients were transported to UofL Hospital downtown, with injuries including back pain and injuries to both shoulders.

FILE REORGANIZATION COMPLETE - The Michae Guyton MVA case underwent a comprehensive five-phase file reorganization using an eight-bucket directory system. Phase 1 generated an inventory of 11 files, including 5 scrambled .md files used for content-only analysis. Phase 2 analyzed all documents with content-based categorization, with filenames scrambled to eliminate bias. Phase 3 achieved a 0.0% error rate (perfect accuracy—0 errors out of 5 files). Phase 4 successfully executed five move operations to reunite all PDF companions. Phase 5 verified 100% naming convention compliance and companion file integrity.

Results: The Client folder contains four files: two PDF+MD pairs—Intake Documents signed 11/17/2025 via Vinesign and the Intake Verification Certificate. The Investigation folder contains two files: one PDF+MD pair—the Jefferson County Clerk Insurance Information Request for plate J8Z536. The Insurance folder is organized by type and carrier and contains four files: BI/Auto Owners with a Letter of Representation dated 11/18/2025, claim #300-0701136-2025; PIP/Progressive with a Letter of Representation dated 11/18/2025, claim #25695180369, with special instructions to reserve $4,000 and use $6,000 for bills, and DO NOT pay hospital bills.

Key case information: This is a multi-party case with four clients (Mi'Ayla Lopez, Antonio Lopez, A'zaire Lopez, and Michae Guyton). The accident date is 11/14/2025, a rear-end collision at Eaton and Dixie Highway. The client group was transported to UofL Hospital downtown with injuries including back pain and injuries to both shoulders. The Fee Agreement is 33.36% pre-suit and 40% post-suit. All files are now properly organized with zero errors and are ready for the treatment phase. Complete documentation has been saved to the Reports/ directory.
episodes.author: Roscoe (AI Paralegal)
